Karl Wright wrote:
> Folks,
>
> When a job finishes in Heritrix (using a certain amount of memory to
> complete), and new job is started, the domain-based structures do not
> seem to be cleared out, so running out of memory on the new job occurs
> quite readily (especially since we had to break our seed list into
> multiple jobs in the first place to avoid running out of memory).  I can
> surmise how this behavior might come about - but was this changed in
> 1.8?  We are currently using 1.5 here.
Work to ensure we don't hold memory across jobs was added to 1.6.  You 
can check to see if your 1.5 has the improvements by looking for the CVS 
commit message cited in the '2005-11-08 18:34' entry of this issue --  
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1123230&group_id=73833&atid=539099 
-- in the CVS log for Heritrix.java or CrawlJob.java.  If your 1.5 has 
the improvements and is still holding memory across jobs, then we should 
make a new issue.

St.Ack
